vmassol1 - (10:16): silviar: would be great to convert these to 2.0 syntax I guess :)  
silviar - (10:17): sure, I will  
vmassol1 - (10:17): cool  
vmassol1 - (10:18): mflorea: seems like the gwt editor is getting traction as a standalone editor! :) We should provide some written text to explain how to use it standalone on xwiki.org somewhere to start with. WDYT?  
mflorea - (10:20): vmassol1: maybe Fady who is currently trying to use the editor outside of XWiki is willing to contribute on xwiki.org  
vmassol1 - (10:20): mflorea: some other guy posted a question this morning  
vmassol1 - (10:20): yes maybe you could ask to share the load indeed  
vmassol1 - (10:21): and get them to participate  
vmassol1 - (10:21): (although people don't usually participate in doc very much but you can try ;))  
mflorea - (10:22): ah, I didn't see the last mail. It's good people are interested and try the editor outside of XWiki because this way I discover what remains to be done to make it fully independent.  
vmassol1 - (10:22): yes

bblfish - (10:41): if I understand well if I use the maven xar, I need to make a seperate directory hierarchy, just for the xml files?  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:46  
vmassol1 - (10:52): bblfish: not sure what you're asking  
florinciu left at 10:52 (Quit: ChatZilla 0.9.86-rdmsoft [XULRunner 1.9.0.15/2009101909]  
bblfish - (10:53): I need to seperate dir (mvn build) for the java code, and the maven xml files  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:54  
bblfish - (10:54): (which seems like a good idea, as I can re-use the java bean for other purposes)  
vmassol1 - (10:55): bblfish: in maven you have one module per artifact  
vmassol1 - (10:55): so that's one build module for generating the jar and one module for generating the xar  
bblfish - (10:55): yes, that's what I see  
bblfish - (10:55): and it means I have to make a new directory hierarchy...  
bblfish - (10:55): I'll do that  
vmassol1 - (10:56): ok  
bblfish - (10:57): mhh, mind you my java code is very xwiki dependent, so it's not really going to buy me that much  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:00  
bblfish left at 11:05 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
vmassol1 - (11:12): tmortagne: good morning. In path-based multiwiki I see there's no more "/bin". So how do you recognize "/bin" vs "/skin" for ex?  
tmortagne - (11:12): vmassol1: /bin has nothing to do with /skin  
tmortagne - (11:12): /bin is servlet mapping where /skin is a struts action  
vmassol1 - (11:13): ok so forget /bin but any other value  
vmassol1 - (11:13): not bin  
tmortagne - (11:13): you don't have /bin or /skin you have /bin/skin  
vmassol1 - (11:13): I mean forget /Skin  
vmassol1 - (11:13): are you saying that /bin is useless?  
tmortagne - (11:14): i'm saying that /bin describe the entry point for struts  
vmassol1 - (11:14): why is it removed in path-based multiwiki?  
tmortagne - (11:14): where you have other things for rest or xmlrpc for example  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 11:14  
vmassol1 - (11:14): (or maybe it's just the doc that is wrong)  
sdumitriu - (11:14): vmassol1: Because /wikis does the same  
anamarias left at 11:14 (Quit: anamarias  
bblfish - (11:15): vmassol: I'll go by having a FoafSsl root, that should help it advance more easily I suppose... Or does it make other things more difficult too?  
tmortagne - (11:15): vmassol1: /bin is the domain based multiwiki entry point for struts and  /wikis/<wikiname> is the path-based entry point for struts  
vmassol1 - (11:15): bblfish: wdym by "FoafSsl root"?  
bblfish - (11:15): FoafSsl.RsaPubKey.xml  
tmortagne - (11:15): we could not easily do something like/bin/wiki/wikiname/view  
vmassol1 - (11:16): bblfish: ok so you meant Space :)  
bblfish - (11:16): yes, I suppose so ...  
bblfish - (11:16): :-|  
bblfish - (11:16): :-)  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 11:17  
bblfish - (11:18): I suppose I could also but the XWikiUserProfileSheet in the FoafSsl space, and then perhaps it's just a small tweak to swithch from one to the other?  
vmassol1 - (11:22): bblfish: yes you could dup it the only issue is maintenance  
vmassol1 - (11:22): usually best is to redesign the exsiting one so that it supports extensions  
vmassol1 - (11:23): I'd like to see what our front end experts say on this (sergiu, jerome, jv, caty, etc)  
vmassol1 - (11:24): (I personally don't know the user profile that well)  
bblfish - (11:24): yes, I think it's probably better to do that longer term, but if people want to be able to switch back and forth a bit - initially - it makes sense to have these a bit seperated initially. It can be merged if people like it  
vmassol1 - (11:24): for now I agree  
bblfish - (11:25): It's probably best to have this really easy to install at first...  
vmassol1 - (11:25): yes  
vmassol1 - (11:26): tmortagne: the url format really needs to be redone. it contains only non logical stuff....  
vmassol1 - (11:26): (which is shown by the code, I have to break the logical flow of it to support this use case for ex)  
tmortagne - (11:26): sure if we don't use struts it's easy...  
vmassol1 - (11:26): don't answer, I'm just ranting  
vmassol1 - (11:27): grr I can't find a way to not have spaghetti code  
vmassol1 - (11:27): ok found a way  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:28  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 11:28  
vmassol1 - (11:38): silviar: this is not correct: http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation  
vmassol1 - (11:38): (I mean it could be improved)  
vmassol1 - (11:38): also you've not set the titles correctly  
vmassol1 - (11:39): and the level headers are not correct  
silviar - (11:42): I changed the syntax from 1.0 to 2.0 and fixed the code/toc

vmassol - (11:59): tmortagne: I've committed some changes to the xwiki-url module a few minutes earlier  
vmassol - (12:00): I'm not too sure of myself (even though the few tests I've added are passing)  
vmassol - (12:00): if you have some time at some point and you could check what I've done it would be nice :)  
vmassol - (12:00): I'll continue adding tests

vmassol - (12:00): ok thx

tmortagne - (12:12): no, i think we already talked about that in the past and AFAIK it's not used anymore since before i work for XWiki :)

sdumitriu - (12:15): +1 for removing it  
vmassol - (12:15): ahh....  
vmassol - (12:15): fun I was the cause for this ;)  
jvdrean left at 12:15 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (12:16): ok removing  
vmassol - (12:21): silviar: one idea. Some images are missing a black border  
vmassol - (12:22): I can be added with this (example):  
silviar - (12:22): i know; was working on it with paint :)  
silviar - (12:22): but a better idea is welcome  
vmassol - (12:22): [[image:profile-home.png||style="border:1px solid black; padding:1px; display:block"]]  
glerouge - (12:22): you can use some css to do it  
vmassol - (12:22): I don't know what's better  
glerouge - (12:23): I think the css way is better, it's faster and more flexible  
silviar - (12:23): ok; thx  
vmassol - (12:24): and if they're too large they can be resized and shown in the full size when clicked:  
vmassol - (12:24): [[[[image:profile-home.png||style="border:1px solid black; padding:1px; display:block; width: 800px"]]>>attach:profile-home.png]]  
sdumitriu - (12:24): vmassol: I think you're bashing people too hard on the mailing lists lately  
vmassol - (12:25): sdumitriu: maybe, I just don't like when they bash us  
vmassol - (12:25): the last one is really kind bashing  
vmassol - (12:25): it's not even bashing  
vmassol - (12:26): saying to someone that his work is ugly and inefficent isn't right  
vmassol - (12:26): unless you can propose something  
vmassol - (12:27): he's been direct and I have answered more politely than he did  
vmassol - (12:27): so I don't consider my answer unjustified  
vmassol - (12:27): but maybe I'm wrong  
sdumitriu - (12:27): He wasn't rude, he was simply stating the truth  
sdumitriu - (12:27): Truth hurts  
vmassol - (12:27): no  
vmassol - (12:28): I don't agree  
vmassol - (12:28): we're supposed to be polite and educated  
vmassol - (12:28): I'm not going to tell him he's an error of nature even if I find him ugly and it's true  
vmassol - (12:28): it's called society  
vmassol - (12:28): there are rules  
vmassol - (12:28): so he can say the same without:  
vmassol - (12:28): 1) being rude  
vmassol - (12:29): 2) ranting without proposing something  
sdumitriu - (12:29): In the same lines, we shouldn't say that Windows is bad just because it crashes so often and it has so many security holes and so many bugs and viruses  
vmassol - (12:29): I never said that openly  
vmassol - (12:29): did I?  
sdumitriu - (12:29): We should be polite and thank the kind folks at MS for giving us this nice piece of software  
vmassol - (12:29): becuase I don't agree  
vmassol - (12:30): that it's bad  
vmassol - (12:30): and that it crashed frequently  
vmassol - (12:30): I've been happily using windows for 23 years  
sdumitriu - (12:30): Criticism helps improve  
vmassol - (12:30): constructive criticism is good  
vmassol - (12:30): and we need it  
sdumitriu - (12:30): Well, that is the problem  
sdumitriu - (12:30): People don't notice how bad Windows is  
vmassol - (12:30): it's about the way he's starting to say things that I'm getting bothered  
sdumitriu - (12:30): They just accept it as normal  
vmassol - (12:31): in several of his emails he's quite abrupt, demanding and not proposing much in exchange  
sdumitriu - (12:31): And when everybody thinks that something is normal, and that something has a monopoly, there are no incentives for improving it  
vmassol - (12:32): sdumitriu: In any case saying windows is bad is just plain stupid. You can say: I think that such part of windows is bad because blah blah…  
sdumitriu - (12:32): He was simply stating that he finds l10n slow and ugly  
sdumitriu - (12:32): I do too  
vmassol - (12:32): so you've just told caty that's she's crap  
vmassol - (12:32): nice!  
sdumitriu - (12:32): But the point is that he was simply raising a problem, in case nobody else felt the same way  
vmassol - (12:32): actually even worse  
sdumitriu - (12:32): Nope, not that kind of ugly  
vmassol - (12:33): you've told caty that she's crap  
vmassol - (12:33): and thomas that he's a very bad developer  
vmassol - (12:33): :)  
vmassol - (12:33): in one sentence  
vmassol - (12:33): :)  
bblfish - (12:33): So I have created FoafSsl.XWikiUserProfileSheet - what do I need to change to use that?  
vmassol - (12:33): bblfish: use where?  
vmassol - (12:33): in your wiki or on incubator?  
sdumitriu - (12:33): It's the same ugly as free software used to be  
bblfish - (12:34): on my localhost  
vmassol - (12:34): not sure what you mean by ugly other than it doesn't look nice  
vmassol - (12:34): I find it nice  
sdumitriu - (12:34): It doesn't have the usability polish that people expect from a professional tool  
vmassol - (12:34): bblfish: you just import the XAR  
vmassol - (12:34): and then for a given user  
sdumitriu - (12:34): vmassol: Try it on a small screen  
vmassol - (12:34): you edit his page in wiki mode  
vmassol - (12:34): and do an include of the new sheet  
vmassol - (12:34): sdumitriu: I did on a 1280 screen  
bblfish - (12:34): ok  
vmassol - (12:35): and no I don't agree that we should make stuff look good in 100pixels screen  
vmassol - (12:35): especially tools for technical guys  
sdumitriu - (12:36): I also find that he's a bit rude, but just a bit  
vmassol - (12:36): yes just a bit  
vmassol - (12:36): but my answer wasn't rude I think  
sdumitriu - (12:36): Saying too often that it's a bug just because it doesn't work the way he expects it o  
vmassol - (12:36): (It wasn't meant to be)  
sdumitriu - (12:36): to  
vmassol - (12:36): and I agree we should fix stuff  
vmassol - (12:36): it's not the pb  
vmassol - (12:36): oh  
vmassol - (12:37): the css has changed on l10n it seems  
vmassol - (12:37): it was working fine when I tried it  
vmassol - (12:37): and not it overflows  
vmassol - (12:37): sdumitriu: do you know how to fix this quickly?  
vmassol - (12:38): indeed it doesn't look nice  
vmassol - (12:38): (the table overflow)à  
sdumitriu - (12:38): Nope  
vmassol - (12:38): too bad caty isn't here  
vmassol - (12:39): I'll ping her on skype  
lucaa - (12:39): I think she just left for lunch...  
vmassol - (12:47): sdumitriu: I've replied to my mail to stefan, let me know if it's better  
sdumitriu - (12:48): Waiting for it  
vmassol - (12:49): lunch time  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 12:58  
sdumitriu - (13:29): vmassol: Still didn't receive your mail  
vmassol - (13:29): sdumitriu: strange I saw it, let me check  
vmassol - (13:30): I saw it because it's added locally when I send it through gmail  
vmassol - (13:30): but indeed it's not made the list  
vmassol - (13:30): I think we have some mailing list issue  
vmassol - (13:30): lists seem slow  
vmassol - (13:33): just received a mail sent 1 hour ago  
vmassol - (13:41): sdumitriu: have you changed anything on l10n?  
vmassol - (13:41): it seems better now  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 13:41  
sdumitriu - (13:42): Nope  
vmassol - (13:42): ah caty tells me that it depends on the content of the page  
vmassol - (13:42): the length of the translation key  
vmassol - (13:42): that's probably why I didn't notice it earlier  
jvelociter - (13:46): vmassol: I've imported xwiki-enterprise-test-ui from contrib/sandbox as a maven project in eclipse, any idea why it would not be recognized as a java project ? I've tried "m2 > Update Project Configuration" but does not change anything  
tmortagne - (13:49): jvelociter: do you have any error in the pom.xml ?  
jvelociter - (13:50): tmortagne: no  
tmortagne - (13:50): hmm what is th type of the pom.xml ?  
jvelociter - (13:50): (I can validate the project)  
tmortagne - (13:50): pom, jar ?  
jvelociter - (13:50): ah it's pom  
jvelociter - (13:50): maybe it should be jar  
jvelociter - (13:50): wdyt?  
tmortagne - (13:50): if you want it to be a java project yes  
tmortagne - (13:51): it's the same with our other test projects  
jvelociter - (13:51): it's clearly a java project  
jvelociter - (13:51): ok  
jvelociter - (13:51): changing that  
tmortagne - (13:51): m2eclipse doe snot support pom project twicker to look like jar project  
tmortagne - (13:52): i talked with Vincent about that but we don't agree one the fact that theses test project should be jar projects  
jvelociter - (13:52): ok  
jvelociter - (13:52): so how does Vincent manage to have them as java project in his IDE ?  
vmassol - (13:53): easy  
vmassol - (13:53): I'm using intellij idea  
jvelociter - (13:53): he configures everything manually ?  
vmassol - (13:53): :)  
jvelociter - (13:53): haha  
jvelociter - (13:53): that's not an answer  
vmassol - (13:53): it just works  
vmassol - (13:53): works much better than m2e btw  
jvelociter - (13:53): so why do you see them as pom projects Vincent ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 13:53  
vmassol - (13:53): because that's we use in maven when a project doesn't produce artifacts  
vmassol - (13:54): what would you put in the jar?  
vmassol - (13:54): if you produce a jar it's for a consumer  
vmassol - (13:54): it's not for the sake of producing one  
jvelociter - (13:54): ok  
jvelociter - (13:54): you mean  xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-2.3-SNAPSHOT.jar has no sense  
jvelociter - (13:55): but it's a PITA for eclipse then  
vmassol - (13:55): when you have a test fwk it's ok that it produces a jar  
jvelociter - (13:55): we need a workaround  
vmassol - (13:55): it's a bug in m2e  
vmassol - (13:55): that they've introduced recently  
jvelociter - (13:55): you can't impose idea to everybody  
jvelociter - (13:55): ok  
vmassol - (13:55): it was working fine before  
jvelociter - (13:55): I see  
vmassol - (13:55): they just decide not to support all maven rpojects  
vmassol - (13:55): I have several jira issues opened to them  
vmassol - (13:55): but they don't care  
vmassol - (13:55): they told me  
vmassol - (13:56): that they don't want to support standard maven projects  
vmassol - (13:56): only a subset of them  
vmassol - (13:56): even if they are valid  
vmassol - (13:56): so I switched to intellij  
vmassol - (13:56): and it's working very well  
vmassol - (13:56): but yes we need a workaround  
vmassol - (13:56): first is to vote forthe isuse  
vmassol - (13:56): and let them know they're not doing it right  
vmassol - (13:57): the pb is that this practice I was using was a best practice we defined in maven for it tests  
vmassol - (13:57): that said I haven't followed up on the maven project for a few years now so maybe there's another practice in place  
vmassol - (13:57): so someone should do some research  
vmassol - (13:58): to find what's the current best practice for inetgration tests projects in maven nowadays  
jvelociter - (14:00): ok  
jvelociter - (14:00): thanks for the explainations  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 14:03  
vmassol - (14:06): sdumitriu: any idea why this style="text-wrap:normal;word-wrap:break-word" doesn't work put on the table element on l10n doesn't work?  
vmassol - (14:07): (the key column doesn't shrink because it has some long keys and they don't wrap)  
vmassol - (14:10): reading http://www.456bereastreet.com/archive/200704/how\_to\_prevent\_html\_tables\_from\_becoming\_too\_wide/  
vmassol - (14:13): ok fixed  
vmassol - (14:14): sdumitriu: can you try it now?  
sdumitriu - (14:14): Sure  
vmassol - (14:14): only pb  
vmassol - (14:14): is the colum's width seem equal  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 14:17  
sdumitriu - (14:18): Looks good now  
sdumitriu - (14:18): Thanks  
vmassol - (14:19): except for the column width issue  
sdumitriu - (14:21): table-layout: fixed  
sdumitriu - (14:21): Why did you add it?  
vmassol - (14:21): it's required  
vmassol - (14:21): for the wrap  
vmassol - (14:21): see http://www.456bereastreet.com/archive/200704/how\_to\_prevent\_html\_tables\_from\_becoming\_too\_wide/  
sdumitriu - (14:22): Indeed  
sdumitriu - (14:25): Do we need the date column?  
sdumitriu - (14:25): It's not relevant IMO  
vmassol - (14:25): I think it's useful  
vmassol - (14:25): I look at it  
vmassol - (14:25): to see when were the last changes done  
sdumitriu - (14:25): Just to let people know when something happened  
vmassol - (14:26): IMO what we could drop  
vmassol - (14:26): is that content + translated content  
vmassol - (14:26): this table on the home is to see the activity  
sdumitriu - (14:32): OK, got your email  
sdumitriu - (14:32): Much better, thanks  
vmassol - (14:33): ok thanks  
tmortagne - (14:42): i have something weird on l10, wiki: normal user can't delete http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XEXWikiCoreResources\_89087\_You\_de even if there no specific right on this page of this wiki and XWikiAllGroup has delete right at wiki level  
tmortagne - (14:42): any idea ?  
tmortagne - (14:42): we used to have a bug about delete right not enough to delete but i was fixed AFAIR  
tmortagne - (14:42): it  
tmortagne - (14:43): "no specific right on this page of this wiki"=no specific right on this page or this space"  
flaviusolaru left at 14:46 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
kibahop left #xwiki at 14:57  
vmassol - (14:58): tmortagne: hmm I think my test is wrong: testCreateDomainBasedSubWikiURL? When there's http://subwiki.domain.ext/xwiki/bin/view/Space/Page should the alias to be resolved be "subwiki.domain.ext" or just "subwiki"? I guess it should be just "subwiki" right?  
vmassol - (15:00): I can answer to my question  
vmassol - (15:00): vmassol: yes you're right  
tmortagne - (15:00): vmassol: alias is always the full host  
vmassol - (15:00): oh so I'm wrong :)  
vmassol - (15:00): ?  
vmassol - (15:01): let me check the query done on the db
